block.p: The Bush administration said it would help dozens of companies seek exemptions to an impending international ban on methyl bromide, a pesticide that damages the atmosphere's protective ozone layer. Officials said the exemptions were not a loophole, as environmental groups claimed, because the companies had no practical alternatives to the gas, which is used to sterilize soils and crop shipments. But environmentalists said too many exemptions would weaken the ban.
